title: Force creating a dataset in a SSH Git repository clone outputs confusing info
body:
In a repository that was cloned from GitHub via SSH protocol, ``datalad create -f`` returns a warning that says "You appear to be using ssh to clone a git:// URL." even though no cloning is involved, and implies a broken git-annex installation on the remote.  

Given that I'm not cloning anything, this information is quite confusing and could look like an error for new users.

SSH clone:
```                                         
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp
╰─➤ git clone git@github.com:adswa/data-version-control.git sshclone      
Cloning into 'sshclone'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 82, done.
remote: Total 82 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 82
Receiving objects: 100% (82/82), 12.48 KiB | 2.50 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (18/18), done.
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp
╰─➤ cd sshclone && datalad create -f
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/sshclone 
[INFO   ] Invalid command: 'git-annex-shell 'configlist' '/~/adswa/data-version-control.git''
|   You appear to be using ssh to clone a git:// URL.
|   Make sure your core.gitProxy config option and the
|   GIT_PROXY_COMMAND environment variable are NOT set. 
[INFO   ] Remote origin does not have git-annex installed; setting annex-ignore
|   This could be a problem with the git-annex installation on the remote. Please make sure that git-annex-shell is available in PATH when you ssh into the remote. Once you have fixed the git-annex installation, run: git annex enableremote origin 
create(ok): /tmp/sshclone (dataset)
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp/sshclone on master
```

Its much nicer in a repository cloned via HTTPS protocol:
```
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp
╰─➤ git clone https://github.com/adswa/data-version-control.git httpsclone
Cloning into 'httpsclone'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 82, done.
remote: Total 82 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 82
Unpacking objects: 100% (82/82), 12.46 KiB | 344.00 KiB/s, done.
(handbook) ╭─adina@muninn /tmp
╰─➤ cd httpsclone && datalad create -f
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/httpsclone 
[INFO   ] Remote origin not usable by git-annex; setting annex-ignore 
create(ok): /tmp/httpsclone (dataset)
```
